Welcome to Phaseflow’s documentation!¶

class phaseflow.benchmarks.AdaptiveLidDrivenCavityWithSolidSubdomain(automatic_jacobian=False)[source]¶

Ideally we should be able to use AMR instead of manually refining the prescribed PCI. Unfortunately, the adaptive solver computes an error estimate of exactly 0, which seems to be a bug in FEniCS. We’ll want to make a MWE and investigate. For now let’s leave this failing benchmark here.

This module contains the core functionalty of Phaseflow.

class phaseflow.core.Point(coordinates)[source]¶
class phaseflow.core.SolutionFile(filepath)[source]¶
class phaseflow.core.TimeStepSize(min=0.0, value=0.0, max=0.0)[source]¶

This class implements a bounded adaptive time step size.

This module contains a variety of useful classes and functions.

phaseflow.helpers.arguments()[source]¶

Returns tuple containing dictionary of calling function’s named arguments and a list of calling function’s unnamed positional arguments.

phaseflow.helpers.mkdir_p(path)[source]¶

Make a directory if it doesn’t exist. Code from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/600268/mkdir-p-functionality-in-python

class phaseflow.pure.GebhartWaterBuoyancy(hot_temperature, cold_temperature, rayleigh_numer, prandtl_number, gravity=[0.0, -1.0])[source]¶

Water buoyancy model centered around the density anomaly, published in cite{gebhart1977}.

phaseflow.pure.make_mixed_element(mesh_ufl_cell, pressure_degree=1, temperature_degree=1)[source]¶

An attempt was made to define this as a sub-class of fenics.MixedElement, instead of as a function; but DOLFIN’s JIT compiler was throwing an error related to its __repr attribute.
